articles.headline: Opting Out of Race, Christie Says, ‘Now Is Not My Time’
articles.snippet: Ending a late flurry of indecision, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey announced on Tuesday that he had decided not to seek the presidency.
articles.abstract: Ending a late flurry of indecision, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey announced on Tuesday that he had decided not to seek the presidency.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a kinetic month in which some of the biggest names in American industry and Republican politics urged him to run for president, Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey spent a quiet weekend at home, coming to a sobering conclusion on Tuesday: “Now is not my time.”
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg, David M. Halbfinger and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: IPhone Gets Its Upgrade, All Under the Hood
articles.snippet: Although the new phone is virtually indistinguishable from its predecessor on the outside, the company says the iPhone 4S is packed with better technical innards, including a more advanced camera.
articles.abstract: Although the new phone is virtually indistinguishable from its predecessor on the outside, the company says the iPhone 4S is packed with better technical innards, including a more advanced camera.
articles.lead_paragraph: CUPERTINO, Calif. — Apple introduced its long-awaited new iPhone on Tuesday. But it wasn’t an iPhone 5. That will have to wait.

articles.headline: Hope Rising, Stores Hire for Holidays
articles.snippet: Many major retailers plan to hire more workers during the lucrative holiday season, a reflection of statistics that show consumers just keep shopping despite the troubled economy.
articles.abstract: Many major retailers plan to hire more workers during the lucrative holiday season, a reflection of statistics that show consumers just keep shopping despite the troubled economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even with a turbulent economy, leading retailers say they expect to hire more, or at least as many, holiday workers as last year, when temporary hiring for Christmas grew nearly 50 percent over recession lows.

articles.headline: Taliban Using Modern Means to Add to Sway
articles.snippet: Insurgents in Afghanistan use tactics like controlling the hours of cellphone use, in addition to selected attacks and some new flexibility on matters like education.
articles.abstract: Insurgents in Afghanistan use tactics like controlling the hours of cellphone use, in addition to selected attacks and some new flexibility on matters like education.
articles.lead_paragraph: LASHKAR GAH, Afghanistan — Punctually, at 8 o’clock every evening, the cellphone signals disappear in this provincial capital. Under pressure from the Taliban, the major carriers turn off their signal towers, effectively severing most of the connections to the rest of the world.

articles.headline: A Court Fight and a Tireless Battle Over an Image
articles.snippet: The battle to shape the image of an American being tried for homicide in Italy began soon after Amanda Knox’s arrest and was waged by both sides.
articles.abstract: The battle to shape the image of an American being tried for homicide in Italy began soon after Amanda Knox’s arrest and was waged by both sides.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Amanda Knox and her family landed home in Seattle on Tuesday, it was the culmination of an exhaustive four-year legal, lobbying and public relations effort that ultimately succeeded when an Italian court overturned her murder conviction and freed her from prison.
articles.byline: By Michael Cooper and Isolde Raftery

articles.headline: Hiring Locally for Farm Work Is No Cure-All
articles.snippet: Many American farmers are finding that the more they try to do something concrete to address immigration and joblessness, the worse off they find themselves.
articles.abstract: Many American farmers are finding that the more they try to do something concrete to address immigration and joblessness, the worse off they find themselves.
articles.lead_paragraph: OLATHE, Colo. — How can there be a labor shortage when nearly one out of every 11 people in the nation are unemployed?
